title: Modeling Prenatal Chromosomal Abnormality Assessment Using Adaptive Risk Prediction Systems

context.prior_knowledge: Basic statistics, probability modeling, and foundational Python programming (optional)
context.additional_context: Utilizing a smartphone-based Learning Management System (LMS) with parallel offline workshops

learning_goals: Learners can identify changes in real clinical data by applying distribution shift detection techniques.
Learners can build risk prediction systems tailored to regional population characteristics by designing adaptive models based on incremental learning.
Learners can compare model update strategies using transfer learning and select optimal parameter combinations.

resources: Virtual dataset (Down syndrome screening sample data)
Open-source machine learning library (Scikit-learn, TensorFlow Lite)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
